intro: Serpocaulon levigatum, commonly known as the smooth serpocaulon, is a small, mat-forming liverwort that thrives in moist, shaded environments. It belongs to the family Porellaceae and is characterized by its delicate, leaf-like structures called thallus. The plant lacks true roots, stems, and leaves, instead having a simple, flat body that absorbs nutrients directly from the substrate. It is often found in rocky crevices or on the bark of trees in temperate regions. Due to its low profile and specialized habitat, it is relatively uncommon and requires specific environmental conditions to flourish.
